intro: Jacquinia, commonly known as the snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caprifoliaceae. These plants are native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in North America and Europe. Jacquinia species are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers that often appear in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
